result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Soyck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

*Attend recommended counseling by agent including domestic relations counseling
*No contact with C.N. or any residence occupied by her or her place of employment 
*Submit DNA sample

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J. Soyck in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-251 and 16CF-218.

4:12 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for plea and sentencing.
There is a plea agreement.

15CF-251: Defendant will plead to Count 4
Counts 1, 2 and 3 would be dismissed and read in

16CF-218: Defendant will plead to single count

Cash bond to be applied to fine/costs/surcharges.

Atty Wallace concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-251: Count 4: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 16CF-218: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Wallace for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-251: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-251: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-251: Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-251: Count 4: Found Guilty
16CF-218: Found Guilty

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification statutes. Victim did not provide a statement and did not request restitution.
Atty Wallace makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court addresses the parties, this is a joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-251:
Count 4:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
67 days jail credit due in event of revocation
Conditions:
Maintain full time employment
Attend recommended counseling by agent including domestic relations counseling
No contact with C.N. or any residence occupied by her or her place of employment
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample

16CF-218:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-251
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Cash bond to be applied to costs/surcharges, balance to be returned to poster.
60 days to pay costs/surcharges or set up payment plan.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 20, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Michael J. Soyck in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF251, 16CF218
1:33 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Wallace requests a continuance for 2 weeks.  He has had trouble getting ahold of his client due to cell phone issues. 
Atty Knaapen does not object. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael J. Soyck in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:54 AM Court calls case.

Defendant shows the Court his notices for today.
Cases heard are 15CF-251 and 16CF-218.
Prior to going on the record, parties found scheduling error.  
Defendant's notice indicate 9:30 am but somehow it was re-scheduled to 1:30 pm.

Atty Knaapen indicates this his files show 9:30 am.

Atty Wallace called in to the JA and gave one case number, to reschedule, not both.  This is why one case is set for 9:30 am and one case is set for 1:30 pm.

BY THE COURT:
Hearing will be at 1:30 pm.
Court advises Defendant to return at 1:30 pm. Both cases will be heard at 1:30 PM.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael J. Soyck not in court, defendant in custody.  David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF251 & 16CF218.

1:23 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
Atty Knaapen makes statement.
Defendant states he was working when he was supposed to be in Court for a hearing.
Defendant is informed that he needs to appear for his court appearances.
Defendant makes additional statements to the Court.
Court questions the defendant further; defendant was ouf of jail prior to the end of July. 
Atty Knaapen would request that the court reinstate the original cash bonds with the same conditions.
Court questions the defendant as to how he can be guaranteed that he will appear for court hearings.
Defendant makes additional statements on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court will maintain the current bonds on both 15CF251 and 16CF218.
Defendant informed that he needs to appear on all of his court dates.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

BY THE COURT:

Defendant Michael J. Soyck in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Michael J. Soyck in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant replies.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.

for Documents and Motion for Discovery

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Michael J. Soyck in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:26 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney John H. Wallace in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared by video. Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Atty Wallace request bond reduction $500 cash bond or sig bond with same conditions.
ADA Constable states is not in compliance with victim notification and states objections to motion to reduce bond.
BTC: Cash bond remains the same and is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Cynthia Nietzke, her residence or her place of employment.
Defendant to contact a public defenders office.

FTR: 1:39:15
ADA Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Strangulation and Suffocation Battery.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $2000 with conditions as stated.
